clinical_study.brief_title: Investigating Brown Adipose Tissue Activation in Humans
clinical_study.official_title: Investigating Brown Adipose Tissue Activation in Humans

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine what can activate brown adipose tissue (BAT).

detailed_description.textblock: We will investigate different stimuli (i.e. hormones) to determine which can stimulate BAT.

primary_outcome.measure: Brown Adipose Tissue Activation Following Glucagon or Saline Infusion
primary_outcome.description: Period 1 Brown Adipose Tissue (BAT) activation measured using metabolic rate of glucose (MR[gluc]) during F-fluorodeoxyglucose (18F-FDG) positron emission tomography (PET-CT) for Cold PET-CT Vehicle vs Warm PET-CT Vehicle vs warm PET-CT Glucagon.

primary_outcome.measure: Increase in Energy Expenditure Following Glucagon or Saline Infusion
primary_outcome.description: Period 2 Increase in energy expenditure measured using indirect calorimetry for Cold control vs Warm Control vs Warm Glucagon.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged >18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- medical conditions
- recreational drug use
- participation in other trials within the preceding 2 months
- blood donation within 3 months of study participation
